normalised: Subject: Home Loan Schemes - Need help navigating this maze!

unnormalised: **Subject: Home Loan Schemes - Need help navigating this maze!**

normalised: So, finally taking the plunge and looking at buying my own place in Bangalore! Exciting and terrifying all at once. The biggest hurdle, of course, is the home loan. There are so many schemes out there, my head is spinning faster than a top during Navratri!

unnormalised: So, finally taking the plunge and looking at buying my own place in Bangalore! Exciting and terrifying all at once. The biggest hurdle, of course, is the home loan. There are SO many schemes out there, my head is spinning faster than a top during Navratri!
normalised: I've been looking at options from S B I, H D F C, and I C I C I Bank, but honestly, I'm drowning in jargon. Fixed rate, floating rate, hybrid... it's like a whole new language. Does anyone have recent experience with any particular scheme they'd recommend?

unnormalised: I've been looking at options from SBI, HDFC, and ICICI Bank, but honestly, I'm drowning in jargon. Fixed rate, floating rate, hybrid... it's like a whole new language. Does anyone have recent experience with any particular scheme they'd recommend?
normalised: I'm pre-approved for around rupee fifty lakhs and looking at properties in the Whitefield area, maybe within a five kilometer radius of my office. My friend, Priya, keeps telling me to look into government schemes like P M A Y, but I'm not sure if I qualify. Anyone know the latest eligibility criteria for that?

unnormalised: I'm pre-approved for around Rs. 50 Lakhs and looking at properties in the Whitefield area, maybe within a 5 km radius of my office. My friend, Priya, keeps telling me to look into government schemes like PMAY, but I'm not sure if I qualify. Anyone know the latest eligibility criteria for that?
normalised: Also, what about processing fees and hidden charges? I've heard horror stories! Any tips on negotiating those down?

unnormalised: Also, what about processing fees and hidden charges? I've heard horror stories! Any tips on negotiating those down?
normalised: And lastly, completely unrelated, but is anyone else craving biryani after all this house hunting stress? Maybe a little chicken dum biryani from Meghana's would help me think straight! Any advice appreciated! Thanks in advance!

unnormalised: And lastly, completely unrelated, but is anyone else craving biryani after all this house hunting stress? Maybe a little chicken dum biryani from Meghana's would help me think straight! Any advice appreciated! Thanks in advance!
